info.title: Dexto API
info.description: OpenAPI spec for the Dexto REST API server

tags.name: messages
tags.description: Send messages to the agent and manage conversations

tags.name: llm
tags.description: Configure and switch between LLM providers and models

tags.name: mcp
tags.description: Manage Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers and tools

tags.name: webhooks
tags.description: Register and manage webhook endpoints for agent events

tags.name: memory
tags.description: Store and retrieve agent memories for context

tags.name: resources
tags.description: Access and manage resources from MCP servers and internal providers

tags.name: agents
tags.description: Install, switch, and manage agent configurations

get.description: Returns server health status
Retrieves the greeting message from the agent configuration

schema.description: Session identifier to retrieve session-specific greeting

parameters.description: Session identifier to retrieve session-specific greeting
parameters.name: sessionId

post.description: Sends a message and returns immediately. The full response will be sent over WebSocket

sessionId.description: The session to use for this message

stream.description: Set to true to receive streaming chunks over WebSocket

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the image (e.g., image/png)

imageData.description: Optional image data to include with the message

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the file (e.g., application/pdf)

fileData.description: Optional file data to include with the message

post.description: Sends a message and waits for the full response

sessionId.description: The session to use for this message

stream.description: Set to true to receive streaming chunks over WebSocket

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the image (e.g., image/png)

imageData.description: Optional image data to include with the message

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the file (e.g., application/pdf)

fileData.description: Optional file data to include with the message

post.description: Resets the conversation history for a given session

sessionId.description: The ID of the session to reset

get.description: Retrieves the current LLM configuration for the agent or a specific session

schema.description: Session identifier to retrieve session-specific LLM configuration

parameters.description: Session identifier to retrieve session-specific LLM configuration
parameters.name: sessionId

get.description: Providers, models, capabilities, and API key status

schema.description: Comma-separated list of LLM providers to filter by

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of LLM providers to filter by
parameters.name: provider

schema.description: Filter by API key presence (true or false)

parameters.description: Filter by API key presence (true or false)
parameters.name: hasKey

schema.description: Filter by router type (vercel or in-built)

parameters.description: Filter by router type (vercel or in-built)
parameters.name: router

schema.description: Filter by supported file type (audio, pdf, or image)

parameters.description: Filter by supported file type (audio, pdf, or image)
parameters.name: fileType

schema.description: Include only default models (true or false)

parameters.description: Include only default models (true or false)
parameters.name: defaultOnly

schema.description: Response format mode (grouped by provider or flat list)

parameters.description: Response format mode (grouped by provider or flat list)
parameters.name: mode

post.description: Stores an API key for a provider in .env and makes it available immediately
Switches the LLM configuration for the agent or a specific session

get.description: Retrieves a list of all active sessions

post.description: Creates a new session

sessionId.description: A custom ID for the new session

get.description: Retrieves the ID of the currently active session
Fetches details for a specific session

schema.description: Session identifier

parameters.description: Session identifier
parameters.name: sessionId

delete.description: Permanently deletes a session and all its conversation history. This action cannot be undone

schema.description: Session identifier

parameters.description: Session identifier
parameters.name: sessionId

patch.description: Updates the title of an existing session

schema.description: Session identifier

parameters.description: Session identifier
parameters.name: sessionId

title.description: New title for the session (maximum 120 characters)

get.description: Retrieves the conversation history for a session

schema.description: Session identifier

parameters.description: Session identifier
parameters.name: sessionId

post.description: Cancels an in-flight agent run for the specified session

schema.description: Session identifier

parameters.description: Session identifier
parameters.name: sessionId

post.description: Sets a session as the current active session

schema.description: Session identifier

parameters.description: Session identifier
parameters.name: sessionId

get.description: Searches for messages across all sessions or within a specific session

schema.description: Search query string

parameters.description: Search query string
parameters.name: q

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 20)

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 20)
parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Number of results to skip for pagination (default: 0)

parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination (default: 0)
parameters.name: offset

schema.description: Limit search to a specific session

parameters.description: Limit search to a specific session
parameters.name: sessionId

schema.description: Filter by message role

parameters.description: Filter by message role
parameters.name: role

get.description: Searches for sessions that contain the specified query

schema.description: Search query string

parameters.description: Search query string
parameters.name: q

post.description: Connects a new MCP server dynamically

name.description: A unique name for the server

args.description: Array of arguments for the command (e.g., ['script.js'])

env.description: Optional environment variables for the server process

url.description: URL for the SSE server endpoint

persistToAgent.description: If true, saves the server to agent configuration file

get.description: Gets a list of all connected and failed MCP servers
Retrieves the list of tools available on a specific MCP server

schema.description: The ID of the MCP server

parameters.description: The ID of the MCP server
parameters.name: serverId

delete.description: Disconnects and removes an MCP server

schema.description: The ID of the MCP server

parameters.description: The ID of the MCP server
parameters.name: serverId

post.description: Restarts a connected MCP server

schema.description: The ID of the MCP server

parameters.description: The ID of the MCP server
parameters.name: serverId

post.description: Executes a tool on an MCP server directly

schema.description: The ID of the MCP server

parameters.description: The ID of the MCP server
parameters.name: serverId

schema.description: The name of the tool to execute

parameters.description: The name of the tool to execute
parameters.name: toolName

get.description: Retrieves all resources available from a specific MCP server

schema.description: The ID of the MCP server

parameters.description: The ID of the MCP server
parameters.name: serverId

get.description: Reads content from a specific resource on an MCP server. This endpoint automatically constructs the qualified URI format (mcp:serverId:resourceId)

schema.description: The ID of the MCP server

parameters.description: The ID of the MCP server
parameters.name: serverId

schema.description: The URI-encoded resource identifier on that server

parameters.description: The URI-encoded resource identifier on that server
parameters.name: resourceId

post.description: Registers a new webhook endpoint to receive agent events

url.description: The URL to send webhook events to (must be a valid HTTP/HTTPS URL)

secret.description: A secret key for HMAC signature verification

description.description: A description of the webhook for reference

get.description: Retrieves a list of all registered webhooks
Fetches details for a specific webhook

schema.description: The webhook identifier

parameters.description: The webhook identifier
parameters.name: webhookId

delete.description: Permanently removes a webhook endpoint. This action cannot be undone

schema.description: The webhook identifier

parameters.description: The webhook identifier
parameters.name: webhookId

post.description: Sends a sample event to test webhook connectivity and configuration

schema.description: The webhook identifier

parameters.description: The webhook identifier
parameters.name: webhookId

get.description: Retrieves all available prompts, including both built-in and custom prompts

post.description: Creates a new custom prompt with optional resource attachment. Maximum request size: 10MB

name.description: Unique name for the custom prompt

description.description: Description of what the prompt does

content.description: The prompt content text (can include {{argumentName}} placeholders)

mimeType.description: MIME type of the resource (e.g., text/plain, application/pdf)

resource.description: Attach a resource to this prompt

delete.description: Permanently deletes a custom prompt. Built-in prompts cannot be deleted

schema.description: The prompt name

parameters.description: The prompt name
parameters.name: name

get.description: Fetches the definition for a specific prompt

schema.description: The prompt name

parameters.description: The prompt name
parameters.name: name

get.description: Resolves a prompt template with provided arguments and returns the final text with resources

schema.description: The prompt name

parameters.description: The prompt name
parameters.name: name

schema.description: Additional context for prompt resolution

parameters.description: Additional context for prompt resolution
parameters.name: context

schema.description: Arguments to substitute in the prompt template (pass as a JSON string)

parameters.description: Arguments to substitute in the prompt template (pass as a JSON string)
parameters.name: args

get.description: Retrieves a list of all available resources from all sources (MCP servers and internal providers)
Reads the content of a specific resource by its URI. The resource ID in the URL must be URI-encoded

schema.description: The URI-encoded resource identifier

parameters.description: The URI-encoded resource identifier
parameters.name: resourceId

head.description: Checks if a resource exists by its URI without retrieving its content

schema.description: The URI-encoded resource identifier

parameters.description: The URI-encoded resource identifier
parameters.name: resourceId

post.description: Creates a new memory

pinned.description: Whether this memory is pinned for auto-loading

schema.description: Input for creating a new memory

get.description: Retrieves a list of all memories with optional filtering

schema.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter by

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter by
parameters.name: tags

schema.description: Filter by source (user or system)

parameters.description: Filter by source (user or system)
parameters.name: source

schema.description: Filter by pinned status (true or false)

parameters.description: Filter by pinned status (true or false)
parameters.name: pinned

schema.description: Maximum number of memories to return

parameters.description: Maximum number of memories to return
parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Number of memories to skip

parameters.description: Number of memories to skip
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Retrieves a specific memory by its unique identifier

schema.description: Memory unique identifier

parameters.description: Memory unique identifier
parameters.name: id

put.description: Updates an existing memory. Only provided fields will be updated

schema.description: Memory unique identifier

parameters.description: Memory unique identifier
parameters.name: id

pinned.description: Whether this memory is pinned for auto-loading

schema.description: Input for updating an existing memory

delete.description: Permanently deletes a memory. This action cannot be undone

schema.description: Memory unique identifier

parameters.description: Memory unique identifier
parameters.name: id

get.description: Retrieves all agents (installed, available, and current active agent)
Retrieves the currently active agent

post.description: Installs an agent from the registry or from a custom source

name.description: Display name (defaults to derived from id)

sourcePath.description: Path to agent configuration file or directory

main.description: Main configuration file name within source directory

injectPreferences.description: Whether to inject user preferences into agent config

path.description: Optional absolute file path for file-based agents (e.g., "/path/to/agent.yml")

post.description: Switches to a different agent by ID or file path

path.description: Optional absolute file path for file-based agents (e.g., "/path/to/agent.yml")

post.description: Checks if an agent ID conflicts with existing agents

path.description: Optional absolute file path for file-based agents (e.g., "/path/to/agent.yml")

post.description: Removes an agent from the system. Custom agents are removed from registry; builtin agents can be reinstalled

force.description: Force uninstall even if agent is currently active

post.description: Creates a new custom agent from scratch via the UI/API

apiKey.description: API key or environment variable reference (e.g., $OPENAI_API_KEY)

get.description: Retrieves the file path of the currently active agent configuration
Retrieves the raw YAML configuration of the currently active agent

post.description: Saves and applies YAML agent configuration. Creates backup before saving

yaml.description: YAML agent configuration content to save

post.description: Validates YAML agent configuration without saving it

yaml.description: YAML agent configuration content to validate

get.description: Exports the effective agent configuration with sensitive values redacted

schema.description: Session identifier to export session-specific configuration

parameters.description: Session identifier to export session-specific configuration
parameters.name: sessionId
